Hi. 25F. I began a weight loss journey in December 2019 and am already 30 pounds down. Still got a ways to go. Most of my workouts have been treadmill on incline, yoga, and light weightlifting with the occasional squats. Iâ€™m not comfortable running yet but hoping to get there. 

Since I began quarantine, Iâ€™ve been trying to do at home workouts. Itâ€™s been a rough transition because I began to love â€œgoing to the gymâ€ but Iâ€™m determined not to lose momentum so making do with what Iâ€™ve got. 

Iâ€™ve found some HIIT workouts online that Iâ€™ve began to do (squats, lunges, jumping jacks, wall sits, etc). The thing is after I do them, the next day Iâ€™ve been sore as fuck and limping around the next two days before I can do another workout. But during the workout I donâ€™t feel like Iâ€™m over exerting myself but instead just getting a good workout. 

I would appreciate any tips on how to recover faster so I can more regularly workout.

I have felt the dread and desire to no longer live because of HS. In addition to counseling (which I think could be really helpful), I think trying natural solutions could help. Aside from when I get my period, my HS has been very subdued since I adopted a healthier lifestyle. I wasnâ€™t unhealthy before but I found my triggers and got rid of them (dairy, nightshades, tight bras). It makes a world of a difference. I used to not leave my bed all weekend because I just wanted to wallow in my misery. Trying AIP and keto and being healthy and cutting sugar and drinking more water has changed my life. As soon as you see the hope and the signs of relief, it is a great feeling. Itâ€™s not an easy solution but I think itâ€™s really worth it.
Donâ€™t want to cohost but I would love to tune in once you do it!
What supplies should I get? Currently I just bandaid it but itâ€™s been day two. And I am using hibiclens around it very gently.

Omg ...
What supplies!!!!!!!!!!
Literally if I could physically change one thing about me, it would probably be that. My latest flare up just left me with a hole in my body like what the fuck.

Yeah, Iâ€™ve been there. Iâ€™m guessing you get it in your underarms too? I would say there are plenty of supportive wireless bras. 

As for deodorant, it sucks. Hibiclens helps keep the area clean. Then I use oils around my arms but not directly where I have HS. 

Here are some best practices:
1. Cut out dairy + night shades
2. Wear cotton/breathable shirts/undershirts (especially if your shirts are not comfortable materials)
3. Use bandaids so any potential leakage doesnâ€™t spread
4. Donâ€™t shave the flare up regions directly
5. Brace yourself for when you get your period (I found ways to control my HS but no matter what I do, it goes haywire when itâ€™s my time of month)
6. Buy hibiclens in bulk and those soap/foaming bottles to put it in for the HS areas 
7. Take it one day at a time and donâ€™t let this condition define you (I needed to learn this the hard way and itâ€™s easier said than done) but youâ€™re gonna have to muster up a lot of self love especially on those days when flare ups are most active. 

Good luck & hope you get remission very soon

Go see one just to be holistic in your healing but I would take your dr advice with a grain of salt. I would say look into the book the hidden plague and really try to figure out what your triggers are. Unfortunately doctors arenâ€™t too well versed with HS from my experience. Youâ€™ll have to find your triggers to determine whatâ€™s the best solution unfortunately. For me itâ€™s been a lot of trial and error.

I guess for me, I figured because the human body is a miraculous thing and we have come so far in modern medicine, that there would be ways to heal and smooth out my skin. To be honest I am not trying to be unkind to my body or do this for other people. Even before HS, I was always about skin care. Personally, I am not really into makeup but always tried to be good to my skin so that it was in its best condition. I just figured I would ask if there were any best practices that could help me heal and then restore my skin back to the way it was, especially with how much is out there in the world today. Iâ€™m commenting here because Iâ€™m quite interested in what others say. I have similar marks but I always thought it was a result of HS. But you (very fortunately) donâ€™t look like you have HS.

Hibiclens is a god send. 

I would also recommend finding a way (itâ€™s hard and it SUCKS), to keep the hair trimmed and at a minimal down there. Especially in the unimpacted surrounding areas. Itâ€™ll help the smell not to spread. 

Breathable, not too fitted, and comfortable underwear is also helpful.

Give up dairy for a few days and see if that helps. Eat your daily fruits and drink lots of water.

Use unscented gentle for sensitive skin soap to wash down there (the outside obv, donâ€™t put anything inside or on the flare ups)

Sleep with yourself spread out if you can and able to air your body. 

If the flare up hurts when it rubs with other body parts or your clothes (since they always appear in the most unfortunate of places), try to band aid it up.

Disclaimer: Iâ€™m only answering from a perspective of whatâ€™s worked for me so take my input with a grain of salt.
